Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class WorkLoad

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.VisualizationObject
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.WorkLoadDescription
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.WorkLoad
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReliabilityParameters
public class WorkLoad
extends WorkLoadDescription
implements ReliabilityParameters
Build the nodes and flows for the workload described in the workload description file, whose name is passed into the Constructor via the parameter inputFileName. Good default values for the constructors are m = 0.9, e2e = 0.99, and numFaults = 1 when the second constructor is used.
Version:
1.4
Author:
sgoddard

  • Constructor Details

    • WorkLoad

      WorkLoad​(java.lang.Double m, java.lang.Double e2e, java.lang.String inputFileName)
      This method takes the below parameters and constructs nodes and flows using the WorkloadListener build nodes and flows function.
      Parameters:
      m - is a double that represents the minimum packet reception rate
      e2e - is a double that populates this flow object as the input is read
      inputFileName - is a String that represents the name of the file used to create a flow.

    • WorkLoad

      WorkLoad​(java.lang.Integer numFaults, java.lang.Double m, java.lang.Double e2e, java.lang.String inputFileName)
      This method takes the below parameters and constructs nodes and flows using the WorkloadListener build nodes and flows function.
      Parameters:
      numFaults - is an Integer that represents the number of faults in a flow.
      m - is a double that represents the minimum packet reception rate
      e2e - is a double that populates this flow object as the input is read
      inputFileName - is a String that represents the name of the file used to create a flow.

      public void addFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method will add a new flow to the Flows dictionary. If the flow being added is already in the dictionary it will overwrite the current entry but also produce a warning so the user knows if a flow has already been added
      Parameters:
      flowName -

    • addNodeToFlow

      public void addNodeToFlow​(java.lang.String flowName, java.lang.String nodeName)
      This method takes a node name and adds that node to a flow corresponding to the flow name. The node is appended to the node array for the given flow name.
      Parameters:
      flowName - name of which flow nodeName will be added to
      nodeName - name of the node to be added to flowName

    • getFlowPriority

      public java.lang.Integer getFlowPriority​(java.lang.String flowName, java.lang.String nodeName)
      This method returns the index priority of a node in a flow. It gets the nodes from a given flow name and then iterates through that set flows nodes in order to find the priority of a of the nodeName.
      Parameters:
      flowName - name of the flow that will contain the desired nodes
      nodeName - name of the node in which the priority is desired
      Returns:
      the priority of a node in a specific flow

    • getFlowTxAttemptsPerLink

      public java.lang.Integer getFlowTxAttemptsPerLink​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method takes in the name of a flow and retrieves the number of tx per link in a flow node.
      Parameters:
      flowName - the name of the flow
      Returns:
      and Integer to represent the number of tx per link.

    • setFlowsInPriorityOrder

      public void setFlowsInPriorityOrder()
      When called this method sorts flows into priority order. First sort the flows by index and then sort them by priority. Creates a new ArrayList and adds the flows in the new priority order. no parameters or return value.

    • setFlowsInDMorder

      public void setFlowsInDMorder()
      When called this method sorts flows into deadline order. First sort the flows by priority and then sort them by deadline. Creates a new ArrayList and adds the flows in the new deadline order. no parameters or return value.

    • setFlowsInRMorder

      public void setFlowsInRMorder()
      When called this method sorts flows into priority order. First sort the flows by priority and then sort them by period. Creates a new ArrayList and adds the flows in the new period order. no parameters or return value.

    • setFlowsInRealTimeHARTorder

      public void setFlowsInRealTimeHARTorder()

    • finalizeCurrentFlow

    • finalizeFlowWithE2eParameters

      private void finalizeFlowWithE2eParameters​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method calculates and sets the flow's linkTxAndTotalCost as the numTxAttemptsPerLinkAndTotalTxAttempts based on the E2E (end-to-end) reliability requirement
      Parameters:
      flowName - is a specified flow object

    • finalizeFlowWithFixedFaultTolerance

      private void finalizeFlowWithFixedFaultTolerance​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method calculates and sets the flow's linkTxAndTotalCost as the fixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost with fixed fault tolerance based on the flow's number of faults (numFaults)
      Parameters:
      flowName - is a specified flow object

    • getNodeNamesOrderedAlphabetically

      public java.lang.String[] getNodeNamesOrderedAlphabetically()
      This method shall sort the nodes alphabetically. Three different sorting processes are needed based on whether the nodes are integers or letters.
      Returns:
      a String Array of the node names in an alphabetically sorted order

      private Flow getFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)

      public java.lang.Integer getNodeIndex​(java.lang.String nodeName)
      This method takes in a node name and returns the index of that node
      Parameters:
      nodeName - name of the node that the user wants the index of.
      Returns:
      index this is the location of the nodeName variable in nodes.

    • getNodesInFlow

      public java.lang.String[] getNodesInFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method takes in a flow name and retrieves the nodes in the given flow. If no nodes are present the method will return an empty array.
      Parameters:
      flowName - the name of the flow.
      Returns:
      a String Array of the nodes in the flow

    • getHyperPeriod

      public java.lang.Integer getHyperPeriod()
      This method computes the LCM of all periods and then updates the current hyperPeriod to new number.
      Returns:
      an Integer that represents the hyperPeriod

    • getTotalTxAttemptsInFlow

      public java.lang.Integer getTotalTxAttemptsInFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method takes in a flow name and calculates the total cost of the specified flow.
      Parameters:
      flowName - the name of the flow
      Returns:
      an Integer representing the total cost of the flow

    • getNumTxAttemptsPerLink

      public java.lang.Integer[] getNumTxAttemptsPerLink​(java.lang.String flowName)
      This method takes in a flow name, gets the flow object and sets a new Array List to the link tx and total cost of the flow. Removes last element because it is just a sum of the others.
      Parameters:
      flowName - the name of the flow
      Returns:
      an Integer Array containing the link tx and total cost of a flow.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(java.lang.String nodeName, Edge edge)
      This method adds an edge to a node by getting the node object a and adding an edge.
      Parameters:
      nodeName - name of the node.
      edge - name of the edge that will be added.

    • maxFlowLength

      public java.lang.Integer maxFlowLength()
      This method records the max flow length by looping through all flows and keeping track of the max value.
      Returns:
      an Integer that represents the max length of the flows
